        Returns:

      • simplifiesClause

        public static Clause simplifiesClause(Clause c,
                      Clause sempl,
                      IndexingClauses indexingC)
        Check if the first clause simplifies the second if yes return the simplified clause.
        Parameters:
        c - clause 1
        sempl - clause 2 (to simplifies)
        indexingC - object for give index to new clauses
        Returns:
        the simplified clause, or null if c not simplifies.

      • simplifiesClause

        public static java.util.Set<Clause> simplifiesClause(Clause c,
                                     java.util.Collection<Clause> sempl,
                                     IndexingClauses indexingC)
        Check if the first clause simplifies any clauses in Collection. if yes return the simplified clauses and remove the correspondent clause from the Collection.
        Parameters:
        c - clause
        sempl - collection of clauses to simplify
        indexingC - object for give index to new clauses
        Returns:
        a set of simplified clauses (empty set if c not simplifies)

      • simplifiedByClause

        public static Clause simplifiedByClause(Clause c,
                        java.util.Collection<Clause> clauses,
                        IndexingClauses indexingC)
        Check if the first clause id simplified by any clauses in Collection. if yes return the simplified clause.
        Parameters:
        c - clause to simplify
        clauses - set of clauses
        indexingC - object for give index to new clauses
        Returns:
        simplified clauses, null if c simplified by noone

        Parameters:

        clauses - collection of clause
        Returns:

                                java.util.Collection<Clause> clauses)

        Parameters:
        c - clause to subsume
        clauses - collection of clause
        Returns:
        true if c is subsumed, false otherwise

      • mgu

        public static boolean mgu(Literal x,
          Literal y,
          boolean sameSign,
          Substitution sub,
          boolean forSubsumptionOrSemplification)
        Calculates the most general unificator between two literals. Update the partial substitution given.
        Parameters:
        x - literal
        y - literal
        sameSign - true if you want unifiers literals with same sign false if not same sign
        sub - partial substitution
        forSubsumptionOrSemplification -
        Returns:
        true if literals are unificable, false otherwise
